page.title: 02GALASHIELS-THE BURGH
page.content: THE BURGH OF GALASHELS,ON THE BANKS OF GALA WATER,GREW UP BECAUSE OF THE WOOLLEN INDUSTRY WHICH HAS DECREASED IN IMPORTANCE IN THE LAST TWO DECADES.OLDER HOUSING IS CONCENTRATED NEAR THE RIVER WITH NEWER HOUSES STRETCHING UP THE HILLSIDES ON EITHER SIDE. LOCAL WHINSTONE WAS ORIGINALLY USED FOR BUILDING,WHILE SANDSTONE LATER TOOK OVER IN THE 19th CENTURY AND EARLY 20th CENTURY. MODERN HOUSING IS BUILT OF BRICK AND HARLING OR PEBBLE DASH. THERE IS STILL A VERY OBVIOUS GREEN BELT AROUND THE TOWN.
